quest.name: The Company You Keep (Immortal Flames)
journal: The Immortal Flames recruitment officer seems eager to welcome you to Ul'dah's Grand Company.
You have confirmed your intention to join the ranks of the Immortal Flames. Visit the Hall of Flames in Ul'dah, and speak with the personnel officer to be formally inducted into the Grand Company.

Your formal induction into the Immortal Flames is interrupted by an urgent report concerning an imperial attack on a Highwind Skyways airship. Head to Horizon's Edge and determine the fate of the crippled vessel and its crew.

You have defeated the imperial soldiers intent on requisitioning the downed airship. You learn that the vessel's crew, Biggs and Wedge, are engineers from Garlond Ironworks, and that Master Garlond himself has been missing since the Calamity. Return to the Hall of Flames and report to the personnel officer.

Back at the Hall of Flames, the personnel officer praises your efforts, and reassures you that the two engineers you encountered were able to continue on their way. He then expresses his eagerness to complete your induction into the ranks of the Immortal Flames. Speak with him once more when you are ready to attend to the formalities.
objectives: Speak with the personnel officer at the Hall of Flames.
Head to Horizon's Edge and determine the fate of the airship and its crew.
Speak with the personnel officer at the Hall of Flames.

dialogue.name: FLAMEOFFICER
dialogue.text: Welcome back, adventurer! I take it General Raubahn's words kindled a fire within you?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Join the Immortal Flames?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: FLAMEOFFICER
dialogue.text: Excellent! I feared that the incident with the traitor may have soured your opinion of us. It gladdens me to see that isn't the case.

dialogue.name: FLAMEOFFICER
dialogue.text: But before we can count you as one of our own, you must be formally inducted into our ranks.

dialogue.name: FLAMEOFFICER
dialogue.text: Please proceed to the Hall of Flames on Ul'dah's Merchant Stripthe Hall of Flames and identify yourself to the personnel officer. I will notify him of your coming.

dialogue.name: FLAMEOFFICER
dialogue.text: With your strength joined to ours, we shall surely prevail over our enemies, be they beastmen or imperials.

dialogue.name: FLAMEOFFICER
dialogue.text: What? You cannot seriously be considering joining another Grand Company! Why, they are not nearly as grand as ours!

dialogue.name: SERPENTOFFICER
dialogue.text: I will not deny that I am disappointed, but I take comfort in the knowledge that individuals are permitted to transfer between Grand Companies. Know that the Order of the Twin Adder would be proud to have you should you undergo a change of heart.

dialogue.name: FLAMEOFFICER
dialogue.text: Before you may take your place within our ranks, you must speak with the personnel officer at the Hall of Flames in Ul'dah. Pray do so at your earliest convenience. I, meanwhile, will bear word of your excellent decision to General Raubahn.

dialogue.name: STORMOFFICER
dialogue.text: So you have decided to cast your lot with the Flames. Well, there is no help for it. Just remember that it's never too late to sign on with a different crew.

dialogue.name: FLAMEPERSONNEL
dialogue.text: What brings you to the Hall of Flames this eveningmorningday, adventurer?

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: How will you respond?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: My name is Forename Surname. I believe you are expecting me.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: I am here to enlist, if you will have me.

dialogue.name: FLAMEPERSONNEL
dialogue.text: Ah, I thought as much! You are just as our man at the Waking Sands described! It is an honor to meet you, madamsir!

dialogue.name: FLAMEPERSONNEL
dialogue.text: Is that so? Well then, I must ask you for your name. Ah, but let me guess. It is Forename Surname, is it not? Yes, you are just as our man at the Waking Sands described. Thank you for electing to join us.

dialogue.name: FLAMEPERSONNEL
dialogue.text: Now, in order to formalize your─

dialogue.name: FLAMEPRIVATE
dialogue.text: Sir!

dialogue.name: FLAMEPERSONNEL
dialogue.text: Speak, Private.

dialogue.name: FLAMEPRIVATE
dialogue.text: Imperials, sir! They've fired on a Highwind Skyways airship!

dialogue.name: FLAMEPRIVATE
dialogue.text: Scouts say she's coming down to the west, near Horizon's Edge!

dialogue.name: FLAMEPERSONNEL
dialogue.text: Bloody hells! Of all the times for this to happen!

dialogue.name: FLAMEPERSONNEL
dialogue.text: Forename, there's no time for formalities! The Immortal Flames need your help now!

dialogue.name: FLAMEPERSONNEL
dialogue.text: We're in the midst of a large-scale operation against the Amalj'aa, and we have no one to spare in western Thanalan. You must get to that ship before the Garleans do!

dialogue.name: FLAMEPERSONNEL
dialogue.text: If there are any survivors, see that they do not come to further harm. Now go!

dialogue.name: Q3
dialogue.text:
Duty calls. Do you wish to proceed with
“The Company You Keep (Immortal Flames)”?

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.text: (-Airship Crewman-)An adventurer!? What're you doing out here? No, wait─let's find some cover first...

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.text: (-Airship Crewman-)The Immortal Flames sent you? How do I know you're not an imperial spy? You don't even have a uniform!

dialogue.name: FLAMELIEUTENANT
dialogue.text: Are you all right, sir? Our scouts reported the attack on your craft. We've come to rescue you.

dialogue.name: FLAMELIEUTENANT
dialogue.text: Forename Surname, yes? Glad to have you with us.

dialogue.name: IMPERIALSOLDIER
dialogue.text: I have not seen a craft of this design before... That traitor Garlond has been busy.

dialogue.name: IMPERIALSOLDIER
dialogue.text: The secrets of magitek are ours by right. They are not to be squandered upon the savages of this land.

dialogue.name: IMPERIALSOLDIER
dialogue.text: We are taking this craft back to the fortress! Dismantle it if you must! And bring the engineer! Someone must pay for Garlond's crimes.

dialogue.name: FLAMELIEUTENANT
dialogue.text: They mean to take the ship back to Castrum Meridianum, along with your friend.

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.text: (-Airship Crewman-)Wedge! You have to help him! That fool of a Lalafell was hiding inside the Tiny Bronco!

dialogue.name: FLAMELIEUTENANT
dialogue.text: Nice-looking ship─though not the best place to have taken shelter, I agree.

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.text: (-Airship Crewman-)It's the first airship we've built since the Calamity─the first since Master Garlond...well, since he went missing.

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.text: (-Airship Crewman-)After years of work, she was finally ready for her first test flight. And she was soaring, she really was─till those bastards blasted her out of the sky!

dialogue.name: FLAMELIEUTENANT
dialogue.text: We attack on my command. Kill them quickly, and save the Lalafell if possible.

dialogue.name: FLAMELIEUTENANT
dialogue.text: Is that clear, Forename?

dialogue.name: FLAMELIEUTENANT
dialogue.text: Show them what becomes of those who play with fire! Charge!

dialogue.name: IMPERIALSOLDIER
dialogue.text: We're under attack! To arms!

dialogue.name: WEDGE
dialogue.text: Biggs!

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.text: Wedge! You shouldn't have stayed with the ship!

dialogue.name: WEDGE
dialogue.text: Th-That was a close one!

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.text: Too damn close. So...how's she look, anyway?

dialogue.name: WEDGE
dialogue.text: The auxiliary propeller is a dead loss, but I think we can wring enough thrust from the main propeller to get us airborne.

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.text: A few minor modifications and we should be able to fly the Tiny Bronco home.

dialogue.name: FLAMELIEUTENANT
dialogue.text: The imperials will come looking for their scouts, but we can defend this position until the engineers leave.

dialogue.name: FLAMELIEUTENANT
dialogue.text: You should go, Forename. You still have unfinished business to attend to at the Hall of Flames.

dialogue.name: FLAMELIEUTENANT
dialogue.text: You're not quite one of us yet, though anyone who'd seen you in action today would be forgiven for thinking otherwise.

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.text: I, um...just wanted to say sorry...you know, for calling you an imperial spy and all that... Got that one wrong, didn't I!? Ha ha! Seriously, though─if it hadn't been for you and the Immortal Flames lads there, we'd be chained up in a dungeon by now. I'm in your debt, friend─we both are.

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.text: Wedge!

dialogue.name: WEDGE
dialogue.text: Thank you! We're very grateful!

dialogue.name: FLAMEPERSONNEL
dialogue.text: Welcome back, Forename. Word of your deeds in the field reached me not long ago. Exemplary service!

dialogue.name: FLAMEPERSONNEL
dialogue.text: Rest assured that the Garlond Ironworks engineers are fine. They were able to get their vessel back in the air before imperial reinforcements arrived.

dialogue.name: FLAMEPERSONNEL
dialogue.text: Your willingness to assist us on such short notice is to be commended. Clearly, your reputation is well deserved.

dialogue.name: FLAMEPERSONNEL
dialogue.text: Now then, I believe we have some unfinished business.

dialogue.name: FLAMEPERSONNEL
dialogue.text: Shall we continue from where we left off and induct you into the Immortal Flames?

dialogue.name: FLAMELT
dialogue.text: Give them no quarter, Flames!

dialogue.name: IMPERIALCENTURION
dialogue.text: Defend the airship! Kill the savages!

dialogue.name: IMPERIALCENTURION
dialogue.text: What are you doing!? Kill them, I said!

dialogue.name: IMPERIALCENTURION
dialogue.text: Where's that bloody vanguard!? We need it NOW!

dialogue.name: IMPERIALCENTURION
dialogue.text: Hahaha! Show them no mercy!

dialogue.name: FLAMELT
dialogue.text: Keep fighting, damn it... Don't...let them...

dialogue.name: FLAMEPRIFIRST
dialogue.text: S-Sir...I don't think I can...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Not now! Not like this...
